titleInfo.title: Brought to the Second Municipality Police Prison.

mods.abstract: BROUGHT to the Second Municipality Police Prison--WILLIAM, a dark griff, about 30 years old, 5 feet 8 inches high; says he belongs to Mrs. Atterron, of Natchez. MOSES, a dark griff, about 20 years old, 5 feet 2 inches high; says he belongs to T. J. Eastman, of Bayou Black. FRANK, a griff, about 10 years old, 3 feet 5 inches hig; says he belongs to Mr. Lanneau. MARY ANN WEAVER, a griffe, about 35 years old, 4 feet 10 inches high; says she is free; supposed to be a slave. The owners will please comply with the law and take them away. J. WORRELL, Warden. New Orleans, May 29, 1851. my29 1aw3w
mods.note: William (30); Moses (20); Frank (10); Mary Ann Weaver (35)
Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
